title: If those Rylai's changes go through, Morde is dumpstered
body:
Removing the HP and adding mana/cdr would make it completely unviable on Morde. Morde is completely reliant on Rylai's at the moment just to function at all. Now you're going to remove the HP he needs to survive as a completely immobile melee champ and add mana that is literally a wasted stat on him. This makes it completely cost ineffective on him.

So how does Morde function now? I understand something needs to be done about Rylai's being abused on certain champs, but if these changes go through you absolutely **must** do something with Morde. He's going to need a mini rework at least.

replies.body:
If you had the time to research the changes to rylies, you should also have had time to research how riot will deal with the situation for champs who build it for HP.

Riot said they will change other items if necesarry to keep champions like morde/vlad/rumble relevant, one example given was changing dead mans plate.
Glad someone else read over that entire post.  Looking forward to what they might do with Deadmans Plate.  Maybe revert the slow back up to what it was originally.
Likely means increasing the slow duration of the empowered attack and making it not decay (like a 50% slow for 1.5-3~ seconds based on level)

The decay is fine, its the momentum loss that needs worked on.  Maybe something like 50ish momentum and up applies the slow while 100 gives the damage amp.  Never feels fair that I have to trudge through all the artillery just to get tagged by some other slow at the last moment and not get to stay on target because they could still run without using a flash.

Like Malicious, I will remain anxious until I know what the replacement is. I really don't want to be rushing a Deadman's Plate and being useless in the early and mid game. Morde players generally don't want to see the game get to late stages, either.

Unless they're planning on changing DMP to a bruiser item instead of a full tank item, how will it help? Oh look, I landed a slow, now to do nothing for the rest of the fight. But don't worry, we'll counteract that by keeping dragon ghost! Your success now fully depends on your team's ability to contest dragon! *cries*

But it's all 'wait and see' as to what the final changes are. I just remember being this anxious about the juggernaught patch, and those feelings were justified!

Like Malicious, if Morde is gutted from a tier 5 champ to a 'this guy is so bad he gets his own tier' champ, I'll probably switch to Overwatch as my main game.

A champion shouldnt be completely reliant on one item to be viable..

I hope they fix mordes problems after the rylais fix, because a good morde is always oppressive i mean fun to watch
